snippet: A new law leaves Ukrainian as the only state language, but it allows public servants and citizens to file official documentation in Russian at government bodies, courts and other state institutions.
abstract: Ukraine’s sizable Russian-speaking minority wins a major victory when a new law is approved that allows the official use of the language in many regions; critics see the change as a threat to their hopes of moving further away from the Russian fold.
lead_paragraph: A new law leaves Ukrainian as the only state language, but it allows public servants and citizens to file official documentation in Russian at government bodies, courts and other state institutions.
